summary: Each year, GAO reports on federal programs with fragmented, overlapping, or duplicative goals or actions and we've proposed hundreds of ways to address those problems, reduce costs, or boost revenue. This testimony before the House Subcommittee on Government Operations and the Federal Workforce discusses our 14th annual report's 112 new matters for congressional consideration and recommendations to agencies to help address our findings. Congressional and...
title: Government Efficiency and Effectiveness: Opportunities to Improve Collaboration and Achieve Billions of Dollars in Financial Benefits
